intro: Aster × tardiflorus var. vestitus, commonly known as the woolly lateflower aster, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and produces showy, blue to purple flowers in the late summer and early fall. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is a popular choice for native plant gardens.
